alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 7:57AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Crawford and Washington AR. In Oklahoma, Adair, Haskell, McIntosh, Muskogee and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sallisaw... Eufaula... Stigler... Cedarville... Natural Dam... West Fork... Vian... Porum... Webbers Falls... Whitefield... Winslow... Marble City... Tamaha... Chester... Brushy... Brushy Lake State Park... Short... Lee Creek... Strickler... Briartown... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
